content:
Passage: School Project

Title: Building a Birdhouse

1. Mrs. Johnson assigned a school project to the class.
2. The project was to build a birdhouse that was functional and decorative.
3. Each student was given a set of instructions and a list of materials they would need to complete the project.
4. Jake was especially excited about this project because he loved birds and birdwatching.
5. He decided to build his birdhouse using only recycled materials.
6. He gathered old wood from his dad's woodshop, some rusty nails, and some scraps of paint from a previous project.
7. He worked on the birdhouse for several days, measuring and cutting the wood, sanding down rough edges, and putting everything together.
8. When he was finished, he proudly showed his birdhouse to Mrs. Johnson.
9. She was impressed with the creative use of recycled materials and the attention to detail in the design.
10. Jake was awarded an A+ for his project and was chosen to present it to the rest of the class.

Which sentence would BEST replace sentence 2 to provide more detail about the project?

A. The project was to build a functional and decorative birdhouse that was suitable for small birds like sparrows.
B. The project was to build a birdhouse that could attract and shelter birds while adding to the appearance of the students’ yard.
C. The project was to build a birdhouse that would be functional and stylish, and appealing to birds.
D. The project was to build a birdhouse that would be both functional and visually appealing, with a special emphasis on the use of natural materials.

Standard: 3.11A

What is the purpose of the project assigned by Mrs. Johnson in the passage?

A. To learn how to build birdhouses using recycled materials.
B. To learn how to attract and shelter birds.
C. To learn how to build functional and decorative birdhouses.
D. To learn how to measure and cut wood.

Standard: 3.11A

What is the MOST effective way to revise sentence 5 in the passage?

A. He decided to build his birdhouse using only recycled materials from his dad's woodshop, some rusty nails, and scraps of paint.
B. He decided to make his birdhouse from recycled materials such as old wood, rusty nails, and paint scraps from his dad's woodshop.
C. Jake decided to make his birdhouse out of only recycled materials he gathered from his dad's woodshop, such as old wood, rusty nails, and scraps of paint.
D. Jake decided to use only recycled materials from his dad's woodshop, including old wood, rusty nails, and paint scraps to make his birdhouse.

Standard: 3.11C

What is the main focus of sentence 9 in the passage?

A. The birdhouse's design
B. Mrs. Johnson's impression of the birdhouse
C. The use of recycled materials in the birdhouse
D. The attention to detail in the birdhouse

Standard: 3.11C

Which sentence would BEST replace sentence 10 to provide more detail about Jake's project?

A. Jake was given an A+ for his birdhouse and was asked to present it to the class as an example of creative use of recycled materials.
B. Jake received an A+ for his project and was selected to share his birdhouse with the class, showcasing the attention to detail in the design.
C. Jake was awarded the highest grade, an A+, for his birdhouse
